Question: What are the email addresses and office locations for professors who manage departments that offer courses enrolled by students living in 'Newman' residence hall?
Cypher:
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[manages:MANAGES]->(department:Department)
MATCH (department)-[offers:OFFERS]->(course:Course)<-[enrolled:ENROLLED_IN]-(student:Student)-[resides:RESIDES_IN]->(residence:Residence)
WHERE residence.name = 'Newman'
RETURN professor, manages, department, offers, course, enrolled, student, resides, residence, professor.email, professor.office

Question: List the names and capacities of classrooms where events attended by students majoring in 'Art History' scheduled after January 1, 2023, were held.
Cypher:
MATCH (student:Student)-[attend:ATTENDS]->(event:Event)-[held_in:HELD_IN]->(classroom:Classroom)
MATCH (student)-[belong:BELONGS_TO]->(department:Department)
WHERE department.name="Art History" AND event.date >= date("2023-01-01")
RETURN student, attend, event, held_in, classroom, belong, department, classroom.building, classroom.room_number, classroom.capacity
Rewrite: Provide the names and sizes of classrooms that hosted events for 'Art History' majors scheduled after January 1, 2023.

Question: Retrieve the first and last names of students who are advised by professors specializing in 'Quantum Mechanics' and are enrolled in courses at level '300'.
Cypher:
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[advises:ADVISES]->(student:Student)-[enrolled:ENROLLED_IN]->(course:Course)
WHERE professor.specialization="Quantum Mechanics" AND course.level="300"
RETURN professor, advises, student, enrolled, course, student.first_name, student.last_name
Rewrite: Fetch the first and last names of students who are mentored by professors with expertise in 'Quantum Mechanics' and who are registered in level '300' courses.

Question: Provide details of all courses, including description and level, that are taught by professors whose specialization is 'Machine Learning' and are housed within the 'Engineering' department.
Cypher:
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[teaches:TEACHES]->(course:Course)
MATCH (department:Department)-[offers:OFFERS]->(course)
WHERE professor.specialization="Machine Learning" AND department.name="Engineering"
RETURN professor, teaches, course, department, offers, course.description, course.level
Rewrite: List all courses with their descriptions and levels, offered by professors specializing in 'Machine Learning' and belonging to the 'Engineering' department.

Question: Can you show the first and last names of professors who teach 'Algorithms' courses attended by students who also participate in 'Tech Fest 2022'?
Cypher:
MATCH (event:Event)<-[attend:ATTENDS]-(student:Student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course:Course)<-[:TEACHES]-(prof:Professor)
WHERE event.title="Tech Fest 2022" AND course.name="Algorithms"
RETURN prof, event, attend, student, enroll, course, prof.first_name, prof.last_name
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (event:Event)<-[attend:ATTENDS]-(student:Student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course:Course)<-[relation6:TEACHES]-(prof:Professor)
WHERE event.title="Tech Fest 2022" AND course.name="Algorithms"
RETURN relation6, prof, event, attend, student, enroll, course, prof.first_name, prof.last_name
Rewrite: Could you display the first and last names of professors instructing in 'Algorithms' courses that are taken by students involved in 'Tech Fest 2022'?

Question: Identify the email addresses and birthdates of students enrolled in courses within the 'Biology' department and who also attended events in 'Green Hall'.
Cypher:
MATCH (student:Student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course:Course)<-[offer:OFFERS]-(department:Department)
MATCH (student)-[attend:ATTENDS]->(event:Event)-[held:HELD_IN]->(classroom:Classroom)
WHERE department.name="Biology" AND classroom.building="Green Hall"
RETURN student, enroll, course, offer, department, attend, event, held, classroom, student.email, student.date_of_birth
Rewrite: Find the birthdates and email addresses of students who are registered in the 'Biology' department's courses and have participated in events at 'Green Hall'.

Question: Can you find the time schedule for professors who lecture in classrooms located in 'Hilltop Building' and advise students enrolled in the 'Physics' department?
Cypher:
MATCH (classroom:Classroom)<-[:HELD_IN]-(event:Event)
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[lecture:LECTURES_IN]->(classroom)
MATCH (professor)-[advise:ADVISES]->(student:Student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course:Course)
MATCH (department:Department)<-[belongs:BELONGS_TO]-(student)
WHERE classroom.building = 'Hilltop Building' AND department.name = 'Physics'
RETURN professor, lecture, classroom, event, student, advise, enroll, course, department, belongs, lecture.scheduled_time
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (classroom:Classroom)<-[relation6:HELD_IN]-(event:Event)
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[lecture:LECTURES_IN]->(classroom)
MATCH (professor)-[advise:ADVISES]->(student:Student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course:Course)
MATCH (department:Department)<-[belongs:BELONGS_TO]-(student)
WHERE classroom.building = 'Hilltop Building' AND department.name = 'Physics'
RETURN relation6, professor, lecture, classroom, event, student, advise, enroll, course, department, belongs, lecture.scheduled_time
Rewrite: Could you locate the lecture timetable for professors teaching in the 'Hilltop Building' and mentoring students from the 'Physics' department?

Question: I am interested in the semester and year of courses taught by professors managing departments with budgets greater than '200k', primarily in the 'Humanities' faculty.
Cypher:
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[manages:MANAGES]->(department:Department)-[offers:OFFERS]->(course:Course),
      (professor)-[teaches:TEACHES]->(course)
WHERE department.budget > 200000 AND department.name = 'Humanities'
RETURN professor, manages, department, offers, course, teaches, teaches.semester, teaches.year
Rewrite: I would like to know the semester and year of the courses instructed by professors who oversee departments with budgets over '200k', especially within the 'Humanities' faculty.

Question: What are the attendance dates for students attending seminars in 'Lecture Hall A' who are also enrolled in 'Introduction to Philosophy'?
Cypher:
MATCH (student:Student)-[attend:ATTENDS]->(event:Event)-[held:HELD_IN]->(classroom:Classroom)
MATCH (student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course:Course)
WHERE classroom.building = 'Lecture Hall A' AND course.name = 'Introduction to Philosophy'
RETURN student, attend, event, held, classroom, enroll, course, attend.attendance_date
Rewrite: What are the dates on which students enrolled in 'Introduction to Philosophy' and attending seminars in 'Lecture Hall A' must attend?

Question: Could you track the enrollment and grade history from 2019 to 2022 for students who are advised by professors teaching 'Advanced Calculus'?
Cypher:
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[teaches:TEACHES]->(course:Course)
MATCH (professor)-[advises:ADVISES]->(student:Student)-[enrolled:ENROLLED_IN]->(enrollmentCourse:Course)
WHERE course.name="Advanced Calculus" AND enrolled.enrollment_date.year >= 2019 AND enrolled.enrollment_date.year <= 2022
RETURN professor, teaches, course, advises, student, enrolled, enrollmentCourse, enrolled.grade
Rewrite: Could you monitor the registration and grading records from 2019 to 2022 for students guided by professors who teach 'Advanced Calculus'?

Question: Please provide the scheduled lecture times and associated course levels for professors from the 'Computer Science' department.
Cypher:
MATCH (department:Department)-[offer:OFFERS]->(course:Course)<-[teach:TEACHES]-(professor:Professor)-[lecture:LECTURES_IN]->(classroom:Classroom)
WHERE department.name="Computer Science"
RETURN professor, teach, course, lecture, classroom, lecture.scheduled_time, course.level
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (department:Department)-[offer:OFFERS]->(course:Course)<-[teach:TEACHES]-(professor:Professor)-[lecture:LECTURES_IN]->(classroom:Classroom)
WHERE department.name="Computer Science"
RETURN offer, department, professor, teach, course, lecture, classroom, lecture.scheduled_time, course.level
Rewrite: Could you supply the timetable and course levels for the 'Computer Science' department professors?

Question: Determine the enrollment date ranges for students in courses managed by professors who hold offices in the 'Central' building.
Cypher:
MATCH (prof:Professor)-[manages:MANAGES]->(dept:Department)-[offers:OFFERS]->(course:Course)<-[enrolledIn:ENROLLED_IN]-(student:Student)
WHERE prof.office CONTAINS 'Central'
RETURN prof, manages, dept, offers, course, enrolledIn, student, enrolledIn.enrollment_date
Rewrite: Identify the date ranges of enrollment for students in courses overseen by professors with offices in the 'Central' building.

Question: What is the average number of students per course for courses offered by departments managed by professors who taught a class during the Fall 2023 semester?
Cypher:
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[teaches:TEACHES]->(course:Course)
WHERE teaches.semester = "Fall" AND teaches.year = 2023
MATCH (professor)-[:MANAGES]->(department:Department)-[:OFFERS]->(course)
MATCH (course)<-[enrolled:ENROLLED_IN]-(student:Student)
RETURN course.name, AVG(SIZE(COLLECT(student.student_id))) AS avg_students_per_course
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (professor:Professor)-[teaches:TEACHES]->(course:Course)
WHERE teaches.semester = "Fall" AND teaches.year = 2023
MATCH (professor)-[relation5:MANAGES]->(department:Department)-[relation6:OFFERS]->(course)
MATCH (course)<-[enrolled:ENROLLED_IN]-(student:Student)
RETURN course.name, AVG(SIZE(COLLECT(student.student_id))) AS avg_students_per_course

Question: Can you calculate the minimum and maximum credits of courses taught by professors in the 'Mathematics' department that have more than five students enrolled?
Cypher:
MATCH (department:Department)-[:OFFERS]->(course:Course)<-[:TEACHES]-(professor:Professor)
WHERE department.name = "Mathematics"
WITH course, COUNT(DISTINCT professor) AS professorsCount, COUNT(DISTINCT course) AS courseCount
MATCH (student:Student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course)
WITH course, professorsCount, courseCount, COUNT(DISTINCT student) AS studentsEnrolled
WHERE studentsEnrolled > 5
RETURN MIN(course.credits) AS MinCredits, MAX(course.credits) AS MaxCredits
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (department:Department)-[relation4:OFFERS]->(course:Course)<-[relation5:TEACHES]-(professor:Professor)
WHERE department.name = "Mathematics"
WITH course, COUNT(DISTINCT professor) AS professorsCount, COUNT(DISTINCT course) AS courseCount
MATCH (student:Student)-[enroll:ENROLLED_IN]->(course)
WITH course, professorsCount, courseCount, COUNT(DISTINCT student) AS studentsEnrolled
WHERE studentsEnrolled > 5
RETURN MIN(course.credits) AS MinCredits, MAX(course.credits) AS MaxCredits
Rewrite: Could you determine the lowest and highest number of credits for courses offered by the 'Mathematics' department professors with over five students enrolled?

Question: Please find the average budget in departments offering at least ten different courses lectured by professors who are advisors for postgraduate PhD students.
Cypher:
MATCH (department:Department)-[offer:OFFERS]->(course:Course)<-[teach:TEACHES]-(prof:Professor)-[advise:ADVISES]->(student:Student)
WHERE student.level = "PhD"
WITH department, COUNT(DISTINCT course) AS coursesCount
WHERE coursesCount >= 10
RETURN AVG(department.budget)

Question: Could you determine the total number of events held in each building which exceed the hosting classroom capacity by at least 20 attendees during the 2021-2022 academic year?
Cypher:
MATCH (classroom:Classroom)<-[held_in:HELD_IN]-(event:Event)-[attend:ATTENDS]-(student:Student)
WITH classroom, event, COUNT(student) AS attendees
WHERE event.date.year >= 2021 AND event.date.year <= 2022 AND attendees >= (classroom.capacity + 20)
RETURN classroom.building, COUNT(DISTINCT event) AS events_count
Rewrite: Can you calculate how many events in each building during the 2021-2022 academic year had attendance numbers surpassing the classroom capacity by at least 20 people?

Question: Compute the average grade of students enrolled in 'Computer Programming 101' who attended 'Coding Day' event in 2022.
Cypher:
MATCH (course:Course)-[enrollment:ENROLLED_IN]-(student:Student)-[attendance:ATTENDS]->(event:Event)
WHERE course.name = 'Computer Programming 101' AND event.title = 'Coding Day' AND event.date.year = 2022
RETURN AVG(enrollment.grade)
Rewrite: Calculate the mean grade of students registered for 'Computer Programming 101' who participated in the 'Coding Day' event in 2022.

Question: Identify the highest department budget among departments whose students participated in at least three different university events in academic year 2023.
Cypher:
MATCH (department:Department)<-[:BELONGS_TO]-(student:Student)-[:ATTENDS]->(event:Event)
WHERE event.date.year = 2023
WITH department, COUNT(DISTINCT event) AS events_count
WHERE events_count >= 3
RETURN MAX(department.budget) AS highest_budget
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (department:Department)<-[relation3:BELONGS_TO]-(student:Student)-[relation4:ATTENDS]->(event:Event)
WHERE event.date.year = 2023
WITH department, COUNT(DISTINCT event) AS events_count
WHERE events_count >= 3
RETURN MAX(department.budget) AS highest_budget
Rewrite: Determine which department has the largest budget, given that their students attended a minimum of three distinct university events in the 2023 academic year.
